Posts.Content: Agree with Sandy, pure aloe vera has been successful for me as well. I am starting week five of radiation and have no skin reaction thus far. I have used the lotion they supply immediately after treatment in the changing room, front and back,  and I use the Aubrey pure Aloe Vera every night (can get it on Amazon or a a health store) . I have not worn a bra post lumpectomy and have adhered to the strict 100% cotton against my skin. I was lucky enough to find a bunch of long sleeve light cotton tops on sale at Coldwater Creek and Kohls. Over these I wear a fleece or sweater vest and no one knows I am braless for the Winter. I am, however on the table for 15 minutes due to it being my left breast and the need for using a machine where I hold my breath while the radiation is being delivered.  The most inconvenient part of radiation has been the coming and going. My cancer center has free yoga, reike and massage for patients in treatment. The reike in particular has been a blessing.  Take good care along your journey.
Posts.Title: Bra suggestions following lumpectomy

Posts.Content: I am headed to this site now. Do you know of anyone who has had experience with Protocel. I read the book, "Outsmart Your Cancer" by Tanya Harter Pierce and Protocel was highly touted in here, but I am not getting muc feedback when I toss this treatment around. Thank you for your response.
Posts.Title: I said no to rad&chemo

Posts.Content: On Feb 04, 2014 4:40 AM jesichashope wrote: There are number of very good options to look into. Protocel has had several names over the years and it not what I consider an active cancer treatment an alternative practitioner would consider as an optiumum choice. If you want to do the best for yourself, look into treatments used that rid cancer in clinic settings. We have an organization that just lists options with explanations. It is just an educational and support site started by Jesicha who had breast cancer. google Jesicha's Hope and read through the researched info.  Thank you for your feedback. It is much appreciated. I will research Jessicha's hope. This site is truly a blesssing!
Posts.Title: I said no to rad&chemo

Posts.Content: Just arrived on this site and Sandy, you and Millie are an inspiration. It is nice to know there are folks out here who are willing to share and support each other.  What a blessing to have discovered this message board!

Posts.Title: I said no to rad&chemo

Posts.Content: I am new to this site and was thrilled to find this thread. I was diagnosed in October, had a lumpectomy and node (4) disection in November, redused the chemotherapy Herseptin trial in December, started radiation in January, now the MO's are "pushing" Arimadex for 5 years. Having read the Arimadex thread here, I think I'd rather drink drain cleaner. I read the book, "Outsmart Your Cancer" by Tanya Harter Pierce and since day 1, have seriously considered taking a holistic remedy called Protocel. Does anyone here have an opinion? WIsh I had come here sooner, as, finally, there are folks who don't think I am crazy question and to not follow the "medically trained speciaists". Eager for feedback! And Bless you all, as none of us really want to be in this position.
Posts.Title: I said no to rad&chemo

Posts.Content: I am headed to this site now. Do you know of anyone who has had experience with Protocel. I read the book, "Outsmart Your Cancer" by Tanya Harter Pierce and Protocel was highly touted in here, but I am not getting muc feedback when I toss this treatment around. Thank you for your response.
Posts.Title: I said no to rad&chemo

Posts.Content: In reading through the Arimadex and Aromasin thread I am consistently seeing whenever someone was looking for "relief" from their doctors, they basically were told the old, "take an asprin and call me in the morning" line. I think you have all convinced me to follow my heart and proceed down the homeopathic route. It is quite apparent the side effects of these toxic drugs destroy quality of life and I am all about quality over quantity. I so want to be around to "enjoy" our children and six beautiful grand-kids, but not in pain and agony. Thak you for being brave enough to share your stories and God bless you all.
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Thank you for your response. I appreciate the two replys here. I have not seen much feedback as far as Protocel, other than the stories in the book, Out smart Your Cancer. I too will look at the site Jesichas Hope and see what is being recommended as alternative treatments. There are phone numbers in this book where you can talk to folks who have experience with this option. Good Luck...

Posts.Content: On Feb 21, 2014 6:59 PM EmilyH wrote: Hi. My name is Emily and my best friend was diagnosed with stage 4 metastatic breast cancer last July that had spread to her bones.  She went through 6 rounds of chemo every 3 weeks and the PET scan showed no cancer! YAY!  She had a double mastectomy and partial hysterectomy (some of the tumors were estrogen-fed) on Jan 13 2014.  She went in for a body scan a few weeks later and they found more cancer under her arm.  They told her they would resume chemo followed with radiation for her bones.   Two weeks ago she went to the ER with severe headaches and back pain.  CT scan showed no cancer in the brain or vital organs.  They put her on pain meds, released.  Several days later she went back for severe headaches, loss of vision.  They did a spinal tap and her spinal pressure was very high and they removed 11 cc of fluid.  They also resumed chemo that day as her oncologist said that it was very important to jump on this NOW. We are supposed to find out if there are cancer cells in her spinal fluid today. I don't even know if I have a question.  We are both 35 - have been inseperable since we were in kindergarten.  Our children are close friends.  She has an 8 year old and a 6 year old.  I don't want to lose her.   I guess since I need a question... can anyone tell me a reason why her spinal pressure would be so high for a reason other than cancer?  Is there any hope?  Everything I have read says once it gets in the spinal fluid prognosis is grim. This sucks. -Emily Dear Emily,  I can not answer your clinical question about your friend's spinal fluid pressure, but what I can do is offer you both encouragement and support. Your fear is palpable, and you are obviously researching to the max, or you wouldn't be here. It appears her medical team is following her closely and treating her cancer aggressively; both which are good at this stage. I can recommend a book titled, "Outsmart Your Cancer" Alternative Non-Toxic Treatments That Work. It is by Tanya Harter Pierce. In it they speak of something called Protocel which can only be marketed as a "nutritional supplement", but given the extent of your friend's illness, it might be something else to throw at these horrible reproducing cancer cells. I read this book when I was first diagnosed with breast cancer, and it is something I may consider trying. You are a wonderful friend. Having people on you team doing the foot-work and seeking all available information, when you are a concer victim, is such a blessing. I send you my prayers and positive thoughts. Dodie
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.

Posts.Content: On Mar 01, 2014 4:19 AM Gigi56 wrote: Is she able to travel?  There are clinics outside US - Switzerland and Germany have some cutting edge ideas.  Also there is a guy in Texas that MD Anderson refers to when all else fails.  Do a lot of research while you can .. I pray for her and you that WE all find the answer.  I believe the physician is TX is originally from Poland.  I wish I had an answer but please research for her and make it happen.  Best wishes, I lost a friend last Oct who did nothing while I was fighting my own.  It is so hard and frustrating.  Best wishes I know you will find an answer. Gigi56,  This is excellent advice concerning options outside the USA.   Who is MD Anderson? Not sure how to find this Texas Doc. To the best friend: keep in mind, when diagnosed with cancer, often one's fear of suffering may be far greater than their fear of dying.  While I believe it is important to support the battle, it is equally essential to support the decision not to fight any longer. As a cancer victim, I would at this stage take quality of life over quantity, but I am in my 60's and have witnessed the marriages of my children and the births of six grands. I am blessed. You and your cherished friend remain in my prayers.
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.

Posts.Content: Thank you Sue! Will definitely take a look.
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.

Posts.Content: I have heard of this, "Forks Over Knives", from other folks with cancer. Once again it reinforces that cancer is about our toxic load. Apparently the key to success is to reduce this toxic load, clear out and alkalnize our bodies and the cancer will not survive. The Docs and the Phamaceutical companies do not want us to know it is that simple!
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.

Posts.Content: Prayers, dear Emily, for your forever friend and for you as well. There is always hope...and faith...and love.  Sending you a great big hug. Dodie
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.

Posts.Content: On Jun 21, 2014 3:40 AM BreastCA4 wrote: Diane, So for you, the believe system- is it afterlife insurance? I am interested in the quality of life, one poster mentioned Satan.....amazing. When the post thread started, a serious question was posted "how do I help my friend" A earnest request, and that meant a truthful answer seemed in order,as a women who is in the same boat, fluffy, albeit well meaning- believe in God, falls short. I hope you not a stage 4 terminal patient, but I am. I recommended some legacy options and then being "present" for her friend. These are concrete "how can I help my friend".....listening, hand holding. This requirement to believe to get benefit, is your approach. Please don't assume it had any value to anyone else. In no other post has the god talk been present and so if you need to spread the good word, please go elsewhere. Please. I am sorry you are in such a negative place. What ever you are seeking, perhaps this is not the best place to find it. Here you will find love, kindness, support and caring from those wanting to be present to help others as they traverse this most difficult journey. Whenever their time here is finished, I know God will be waiting for them with open and loving arms. If you are looking for a argumentative discussion on theology, I suggest you find a site where life is not so fragile and where your hurtful words will not harm those in the weakest moments in their lives.
Posts.Title: Best friend has stage 4 cancer - getting worse. I'm lost.
